p: Each A. butcheri was measured to the nearest 1 mm (total length), weighed to the nearest 1 g and sexed. The smallest fish, which could not be sexed, were designated randomly (and in equal numbers) as either females or males. The sagittal otoliths of each A. butcheri were removed and examined whole using a dissecting microscope under reflected light. The opaque zones were counted in whole otoliths when their number was ≤6 and in sectioned otoliths when their number was greater (see Sarre & Potter, 2000), with the counts then used to age the fish. Full details of the aging procedures are given in Cottingham et al. ( 2014).
